sub_topics.title: Classroom Orders and Instructions in French
competences: Use classroom orders and instructions in French

instructional_blocks.hook: Imagine a place where you learn new things, play with your friends and grow everyday. That place is your school. Let us talk about what makes your school special in French.
teacher_steps: Give instructions in French accompanied by gestures
Learners listen to a set of demonstrated instructions and respond appropriately (e.g. Entrez!/Venez! Va a ta place! Levez-vous!)
learner_steps: Listen to a list of French classroom expressions
Find their meaning in English (Sortez - Entrez - Taisez-vous…)
Respond appropriately to demonstrated instructions

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing classroom expressions/commands/orders in French
teacher_steps: Provide revision on 'Les adjectifs possessifs'
Guide learners to find the meaning of different classroom instructions and commands in groups
learner_steps: Work in groups to find the meaning of different classroom instructions and commands

instructional_blocks.hook: Dramatizing classroom expressions or orders
teacher_steps: Guide learners to role play classroom orders (Levez-vous!, Asseyez-vous!, Ecoutez!, Repetez!…)
learner_steps: Role play classroom orders

instructional_blocks.hook: Reading classroom expressions and translating them from French to English and vice versa
teacher_steps: Provide classroom expressions for reading and translation
learner_steps: Read and translate classroom expressions from French to English and vice versa

sub_topics.short_notes: Classroom orders and instructions are essential for creating a productive and supportive learning environment. A well ordered classroom minimizes distractions allowing learners to focus better on their studies. In this subtopic, learners will learn key phrases used by teachers and learners in a French speaking classroom such as common commands, instructions and questions that facilitate communication.

vocabulary.term: Ouvre ton livre à la page 3!

questions: Use classroom orders and instructions in French correctly

sub_topics.title: My School Subjects
competences: Identify different school subjects in French

instructional_blocks.hook: Listing different subjects offered in a school
teacher_steps: Ask learners to mention the subjects they know in secondary school
Provide a simple passage on 'Les matières' (e.g Le Français, l'anglais, les mathématiques, le civisme, la géographie, l'histoire, l'éducation religieuse, l'informatique, les sciences etc…)
learner_steps: Mention the subjects they know in secondary school
Identify and list the different subjects mentioned in the passage

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing school subjects (les matières préferées)
teacher_steps: Explain Comparatif: 'Que' (e.g. Je préfère les Mathématiques que la Biologie)
Explain Superlatif: plus…que, très…que (La Science est plus facile que la Géographie. Le Français est très intéressant que l'Histoire)
Explain Egalité: Aussi…que (e.g. La Physique est aussi difficile que la Chimie)
Explain Infériorité: Moins…que (e.g. L'Anglais est moins facile que les Mathématiques)
Explain use of Parce que… (E.g. Je préfère les Mathématiques parce que je veux être ingénieur)
learner_steps: Work in groups to make sentences using verbs préférer and aimer (e.g J'aime le Civisme, Nous préférons l'informatique, Il n'aime pas la Chimie)

instructional_blocks.hook: Writing a simple composition on one's favourite subjects and explain why
teacher_steps: Guide learners on composition structure: Your name, school, number and names of subjects, subjects preferred…
learner_steps: Write a guided composition on subjects they like and why

sub_topics.short_notes: This sub topic will enable learners to learn names of different school subjects in French and be able to express preferences about their favorite and least favorite subjects. The sub-topic will also introduce how to ask questions about subjects and discuss the subjects learners study.

questions: Identify different school subjects in French correctly

sub_topics.title: School Timetable

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing a school timetable (Remplir son emploi du temps avec les matières de son école)
teacher_steps: Provide and explain vocabulary that is related to a school timetable (e.g les matières, classes, jour de la semaine, récréation, heure…)
Present a sample of a school timetable written in French
learner_steps: In groups, discuss the various French terms used on the given sample of a timetable

instructional_blocks.hook: Formulating own study timetable (l'horaire personnel)
teacher_steps: Provide learners with a blank timetable (a table with days of the week and times of the day)
learner_steps: Fill in the blank timetable given in French (Les mathématiques, le français…)
After filling in their personal timetables, share with partners or the class on what they do each day

Interpret their timetable and practice constructing simple sentences in French using the vocabulary learned (e.g le lundi, j'ai les Mathématiques à 9.00 heures. Le vendredi, j'ai l'anglais après la recréation…)

instructional_blocks.hook: Writing a simple composition including the name of your school/subjects you take and like
teacher_steps: Provide a sample of guided composition in which a learner introduces him/herself and talk about their favourite subjects (e.g. Bonjour, je m'appelle Mulenga. J'ai quinze ans. J'habite à Lusaka. Je suis un élève à l'école David Kaunda. J'aime le français et la géographie. Ma matière préférée est…)
learner_steps: Write similar compositions using their own information

instructional_blocks.hook: Listing different classroom objects (la table, le tableau…)
teacher_steps: Show real items or images and say their names in French (e.g un stylo, un crayon)
Provide a short passage about classroom objects
learner_steps: Each learner picks an object from their desk and says its name in French
Play a game (cherchez et trouvez une gomme…)
Draw the classroom items and label them in French (la table, le stylo, le banc, la gomme…)
Answer questions from the passage

instructional_blocks.hook: Dramatizing the named classroom objects using interrogative expressions (Qu'est-ce que c'est? C'est…)
teacher_steps: Explain 'les adjectifs démonstratifs': ce, cet, cette, ces (this, these) (e.g ce livre est bleu, cet élève est intelligent, cette table est sale, ces stylos sont rouges)
learner_steps: Dramatize the names of classroom objects (e.g. Qu'est-ce que c'est? C'est le stylo)
Identify the correct 'adjectif démonstratif' (e.g. … stylo, … ordinateur, … crayons, … table)

sub_topics.short_notes: Planning is an important aspect of every person's daily activities. In this sub topic, learners will learn how to plan for their daily activities and come up with timetables in French. A school timetable is a summarised plan that describes learners activities. It smoothly guides learners to pursue their academic activities without any stress. This sub-topic discusses school and personal timetable and classroom objects.

questions: Draw school and personal timetables correctly

sub_topics.title: Telling Time
competences: Identify days of the week and months of the year in French

instructional_blocks.hook: Show a series of pictures representing different daily activities (e.g. waking up, eating breakfast, going to work/school, exercising…). Ask students to identify these activities and arrange them in the order of a typical day.
teacher_steps: Provide a dialogue or conversation in which people ask and tell time
Explain the expressions used to ask and tell time in French
learner_steps: Listen to a dialogue or conversation in which people ask and tell time in French (Quelle heure est-il? Il est…)
Identify expressions used to ask and tell time (e.g Quelle heure est-il? Il est quelle heure? Vous avez l'heure, s'il vous plaît?…)

instructional_blocks.hook: Asking and telling time in French
teacher_steps: Provide different expressions used to ask and tell time in French (Quelle heure est-il?… Il est 7 heures 30. Il est quelle heure? Il est 12 heures. Vous avez l'heure, s'il vous plaît? Oui, il est 16 heures....)
Use visual aid like a clock or digital timer showing different times. Read the time aloud and ask learners to repeat after you
Use a large paper clock with moveable hands. Call each learner to position the clock hands to match the time given
Explain expressions to indicate half hour and quarter hour in French (…et demi, …et quart...) (e.g. je mange à douze heures et demi, Le bus arrive à huit heures et quart)
learner_steps: Repeat the time expressions after the teacher
Position clock hands to match given times
Practice using half hour and quarter hour expressions

instructional_blocks.hook: Reading a passage on a bus schedule indicating departure and arrival time
teacher_steps: Provide a passage on a bus schedule indicating departure or arrival time
learner_steps: Read the passage and answer questions relating to departure or arrival times (e.g. A quelle heure le bus arrive à Kitwe? Le bus arrive à Kitwe à 14 heures 30)

instructional_blocks.hook: Writing how to ask and tell time in French
teacher_steps: Provide a written dialogue on asking and telling time with blank spaces
learner_steps: Complete the dialogue on asking and telling time in French (e.g. Masauso: Quelle heure est-il? Namakao: .…. dix heures. Masauso: C'est …. heure la géographie? Namakao: La géographie est à ………..heures)

instructional_blocks.hook: Narrating daily activities in chronological order
teacher_steps: Provide a passage of a person narrating their daily activities
learner_steps: Identify the activities of the person in the passage and what time they are performed
In groups, narrate their daily activities with the time they are performed (e.g. à six heures, je me lave, à sept heures, je prends le petit déjeuner)

instructional_blocks.hook: Making a diary in French
teacher_steps: Provide a written dialogue on daily routines in French
Provide a cloze passage on daily routine accompanied with possible answers (Answers: douze, vais, je, à, e.g. Le matin, je me lève …. 6h45. A 8h00, je … à l'école, et … mange mon déjeuner à ….heures)
learner_steps: Role-play the dialogue in French (Nkisu: 'À quelle heure tu prends ton petit déjeuner?' Wana: Je prends mon petit déjeuner à huit heures et demi. Nkisu: 'Qu'est-ce que tu fais après l'école?' Wana: Je fais la vaisselle)
Complete the cloze passage on daily routine

instructional_blocks.hook: Writing on one's daily activities
teacher_steps: Guide learners on writing a paragraph on daily activities
learner_steps: Write a paragraph on their daily activities in a chronological order

instructional_blocks.hook: Naming the days of the week and months of the year
teacher_steps: Provide a list of days of the week in French and their pronunciation
Provide a list of months of the year in French and their pronunciation
learner_steps: Write down the days of the week and pronounce them in French correctly (Lundi, mardi…)
Write down the months of the year and pronounce them in French correctly (janvier, février…)

instructional_blocks.hook: Making a calendar
teacher_steps: Using a real calender, explain the features of a calender (la date, jour de la semaine, les mois de l'année)

Guide learners on how to make a calender (Step 1: write a year on top e.g. 2025. Step 2: write a month on top e.g. Janvier, février… Step 3: Fill in the days of the week e.g. lundi, mardi, mercredi, jeudi… Step 4: Fill in the dates e.g. 1, 2, 3, 4…)
learner_steps: Make a calendar for the year

sub_topics.short_notes: Understanding how to tell time in French is a fundamental skill for learners. Time is an essential aspect of daily life, and knowing how to express it accurately enables learners to engage in a variety of everyday activities, from scheduling appointments to discussing plans and routines. In French, telling time differs slightly from English, particularly in expressing hours and minutes, as well as in the formal and informal structures used in conversations about time. Expressing daily activities is a universal concept that is relevant and relatable to all learners, regardless of their cultural background. This topic lays a foundation for everyday communication and helps learners to gain confidence in daily conversations.

questions: Narrate daily activities in French accordingly
Identify days of the week and months of the year in French correctly

sub_topics.title: Past Actions

instructional_blocks.hook: Show a picture of an action and say 'Aujourd'hui, je mange. Hier, j'ai mangé'. Ask the learners to guess the meaning of the second sentence.
teacher_steps: Play an audio or read a passage in which le passé composé has been used for the learners to understand the structure and its usage
Guide learners in identifying the structure (le passé composé) from the passage (e.g. Hier, je suis allé au marché. J'ai acheté une pomme)
learner_steps: Listen to a passage on past happenings (je suis allé hier, j'ai mangé)
In groups, identify the structure (le passé composé) used from the passage given

instructional_blocks.hook: Composing le passé composé
teacher_steps: Explain the formation of le passé composé
Explain L'auxiliaire (helping verb) – Either avoir or être, used to form the past tense
Explain Conjugaison du verbe avoir et être au temps présent
Explain Formation du participe passé des verbes réguliers (-er): When forming the participe passé of -er verbs, remove -er and add -é (e.g manger - mangé)
Explain structure: Sujet + avoir + (participe passé) - Chanter: Elle a chanté. Sujet + être + (participe passé) - Aller: Je suis allé à l'église
learner_steps: Complete sentences given with the correct form of the verbs in brackets using le passé composé (e.g. Il ... (achêter) la chemise. Il a achêté la chemise)

instructional_blocks.hook: Distinguishing the verbs that use être and avoir
teacher_steps: Explain le passé composé avec être: some verbs have être as the auxiliary verb instead of avoir (e.g. A group of common verbs mostly connected with movement and change)

Teach pairs of opposite verbs: aller (to go) - venir (to come), arriver (to arrive) - partir (to leave), entrer (to go in) - sortir (to go out), monter (to go up) - descendre (to go down), naître (to be born) - mourir (to die), devenir (to become), rentrer (to go back), rester (to stay), retourner (to return), revenir (to come back), tomber (to fall)
Explain that all reflexive verbs use être as auxiliary verb (e.g. se laver, se lever)

Explain L'accord du participe passé en genre et en nombre – Agreement of the past participle with the subject when using the auxiliary être (e.g. il est parti /elle est partie, ils sont allés /elles sont allées)
Provide le participe passé of verbs that use the auxiliary être
learner_steps: Transform the given sentences from present to le passé composé using être (e.g. Elle va au marché - Elle est allée au marché. Nous entrons dans la salle - Nous sommes entrées /entres dans la salle)

Complete the passage using the correct auxiliary verb and le participe passé (e.g. Hier, je …. (aller) à l'école. Je ….. (arriver) à 7.30 heures. Nous ….(étudier) le français avec mes amis. Apres classe, je ….. (rentrer) a la maison. Je …. (manger) mon déjeuner à 13.00 heures)

instructional_blocks.hook: Role playing past actions using être/avoir + participe passé (passé composé)
teacher_steps: Guide learners to talk about past activities
learner_steps: In pairs talk about what they did during the weekend

instructional_blocks.hook: Reading a passage on past happenings
teacher_steps: Provide a short passage on past events
learner_steps: Respond to the questions based on the passage

instructional_blocks.hook: Writing a story on past events using pictures
teacher_steps: Provide picture stories
learner_steps: Narrate a story in the past using the given pictures

instructional_blocks.hook: Composing a story from past events
teacher_steps: Introduce expressions used to narrate a story in the past (e.g. Hier (yesterday), La semaine dernière (last week), Il y a… (… ago), Ce matin (this morning), Quand J'étais petit(e), J'étais calme)
Explain l'imparfait: L'Imparfait is sometimes called the past continuous tense. It is not made up of two parts like le passé composé, but it is just one word made of a stem and an ending
Explain that the stem is the nous form of the present tense of the verb minus the -ons
Provide formation table for l'imparfait: Regarder - Nous regardons - regard - regardions; Prendre - Nous prenons - Pren - Prenions
Explain the endings: Je -ais, Tu -ais, Il/Elle/On -ait, Nous -ions, Vous -iez, Ils/Elles -aient
Explain how to write an imaginative story from the past events
learner_steps: Write an imaginative story from past events using le passé composé and l'imparfait

sub_topics.short_notes: The past refers to a time that has already happened, before the present moment. It could be recent (yesterday, last week) or distant (years ago). The past usually means past tense and it is used to talk about actions or events that have already happened. In French, learners start by learning passé composé which is the most commonly used past tense in everyday conversations. It is used to talk about completed actions in the past. Understanding past actions and the tenses used to describe them is essential as it allows learners to share their experiences, tell stories and connect events that shape their day to day lives.

vocabulary.definition: Compound past tense (used for completed actions)
Agreement of the past participle with the subject

questions: Describe past actions in French correctly using le passé composé
Use appropriate auxiliary verbs (avoir or être) with past participles
Apply correct agreement of past participle with subject when using être

sub_topics.title: Weather Conditions
competences: Describe what the weather is like in French

instructional_blocks.hook: Show a picture depicting a cold weather and say 'aujourd'hui, il fait très froid.' Ask the learners what the weather is like.
teacher_steps: Provide a dialogue (audio) about weather (e.g. Michelo: Salut! Quel temps fait-il aujourd'hui? Mutale: Il fait beau et chaud. Michelo: Ah, super! Hier il faisait très froid. Mutale: Oui, il y a du soleil aujourd'hui)
Guide the learners to read the dialogue and explain the expressions used to talk about weather
learner_steps: Identify the expressions used to talk about weather from a given dialogue (il fait beau, froid…)
In pairs, role-play the dialogue on weather

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing what the weather is like on a particular day
teacher_steps: Introduce more expressions to talk about weather (e.g. Il pleut, il fait du vent)
learner_steps: In groups, describe the weather of a particular day

instructional_blocks.hook: Display a chart showing different types of weather conditions
teacher_steps: Provide a chart showing different types of weather conditions
learner_steps: Construct sentences on the different weather conditions displayed on the chart

instructional_blocks.hook: Reading a passage on different types of weather conditions
teacher_steps: Provide a passage on different types of weather conditions
learner_steps: Answer questions based on the passage

instructional_blocks.hook: Writing different dictated expressions used to talk about weather in French
teacher_steps: Dictate different expressions used to talk about weather in French
learner_steps: Write the dictated expressions

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing the different seasons in Zambia
teacher_steps: Explain the different seasons in Zambia (saison sèche, saison de pluie…)
learner_steps: Name different seasons in Zambia
Identify months of the year for each season in French (e.g. saison de pluie - octobre, novembre, décembre, janvier, février, mars, avril)

instructional_blocks.hook: Describing the different seasons in French (local/foreign)
teacher_steps: Introduce and explain the seasons in French (e.g. Printemps, l'hiver, l'été, l'automne)
Show learners a video/images of different seasons in French
learner_steps: Read and pronounce the seasons correctly
Watch a video/images of different seasons in French
Match the given images to the correct seasons in French

sub_topics.short_notes: The term weather encompasses a set of atmospheric conditions like temperature, rain, wind and sun that are observed at specific time in a particular place. Weather conditions refers to the temporary and local state of the atmosphere at a specific place and time, including factors such as: temperature, rain, clouds, wind etc. This sub topic is essential for learners as it equips them with the basic vocabulary and expressions needed to describe the various weather conditions they encounter daily.

sub_topics.title: Clothes and Activities
competences: Describe activities and clothes associated with seasons in French

instructional_blocks.hook: Weather plays an important role in our daily lives. It influences our activities, mood, and clothes.
teacher_steps: Provide a passage or dialogue on different seasons and the type of clothes to wear (Dialogue: Wana: Salut Wanji! Il fait très froid aujourd'hui, non? Wanji: Oui, c'est la saison froide! Moi, je mets un manteau et un tricot. Wana: Moi aussi! Et j'adore boire du chocolat chaud quand il fait froid. Wanji: Et toi, qu'est-ce que tu mets dans la saison sèche? Wana: Je mets un t-shirt, une jupe ou un short, et des sandales. Et toi? Wanji: Moi, je mets une culotte et des lunettes de soleil. J'aime aller à la mer! Wana: Et la saison de pluie, quand il pleut? Wanji: Je mets un imperméable et des baskets. Et toi? Wana: Je porte un manteau de pluie et des bottes et j'apporte aussi un parapluie. Wanji: ok. Au revoir! Wana: A bientôt!)
learner_steps: Listen to a dialogue or conversation in which people are discussing clothes associated with the different seasons (froide – le tricot, sèche - culotte, T-shirt)
Identify and mention each type of season and clothes to wear
Match the different clothes to the correct seasons in French

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing activities associated with different seasons
teacher_steps: Guide discussion on activities done in each season
learner_steps: Discuss activities done in each season (e.g: froide-récolter, pluie-cultiver)

instructional_blocks.hook: Reading a passage on clothes and activities associated with different seasons
teacher_steps: Provide a passage on clothes and activities associated with different seasons
learner_steps: In pairs, read the passage provided and make summary notes
Write a summary on clothes and activities associated with different seasons

sub_topics.short_notes: Weather plays an important role in our daily lives. It influences our activities, mood, and clothes. Depending on the season, we adapt our clothes and activities to feel comfortable and enjoy the weather.

questions: Describe activities and clothes for specific seasons in French correctly

sub_topics.title: Factors Affecting Weather
competences: Discuss Factors Affecting Weather in Zambia

instructional_blocks.hook: Weather is a complex phenomenon that is influenced by many factors
teacher_steps: Provide a passage on factors affecting weather (e.g. La météo change chaque jour. Il fait chaud quand le soleil brille. Il fait froid quand il y a du vent. Les nuages cachent le soleil. Le ciel est sombre quand il pleut beaucoup)
learner_steps: Identify factors affecting weather from a given passage (temperature, les vents)
Read and identify factors affecting weather (e.g. le soleil, la température, le vent, les nuages….)

instructional_blocks.hook: Discussing factors affecting weather in Zambia
teacher_steps: Explain other factors affecting weather in Zambia (e.g. déforestation, changement climatique, sécheresse...)
Give summarized notes in French on factors affecting climate change in Zambia
learner_steps: Discuss factors affecting weather in Zambia

sub_topics.short_notes: Weather is a complex phenomenon that is influenced by many factors such as atmospheric conditions, geographic factors and human activities. Understanding the factors that influence the weather is essential for predicting weather conditions and marking informed decisions to protect people and the world we live in.

questions: Discuss factors affecting weather in French correctly
